feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL MARINE LAYER FOLLOWED BY WARMER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK... Warmer than normal temperatures are expected by late this weekend as temperatures rise by a couple degrees each day. The warmest days are expected to be early next week with highs in the mid 70s and continued dry conditions.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY WARM NEXT WEEK... Temperatures will soar this weekend with highs up to 75 to 85 degrees. The warmest days are expected to be Monday through Wednesday. entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County northeast of Happy Jack through 700 PM MST... entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 6:02PM MST until June 23 at 8:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE TELEGRAPH BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 602 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Telegraph Burn Scar. Elevated flow in Rancho Rio Creek is possible or ongoing. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:09PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRST HEAT WAVE OF THE SEASON EXPECTED THIS WEEKEND FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON AND NORTHWEST OREGON... Summer weather is expected to begin in earnest across much of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon this Friday, continuing through the weekend. For inland valleys, temperatures will reach well into the 80s Friday, possibly even reaching the lower 90s in
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills; South Washington Cascades; South Washington Coast; Western Columbia River Gorge; Willapa Hills

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 8:25PM CDT until June 23 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL ST. LOUIS...EASTERN CARLTON AND WEST CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 824 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Carlton, or near Cloquet, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.
